meanings.definition: To surpass in stealing or thievery.
meanings.sent1: The sneaky raccoon outthieved the clever fox by taking all the shiny objects.
meanings.sent2: The thief outthieved his partner by stealing the most valuable painting.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat outthieved the dog by snatching all the treats.
meanings.sent4: The master thief outthieved all his competitors in the art of stealing.
meanings.sent5: The cunning pickpocket outthieved everyone in the crowded market.

meanings.definition: To have stolen more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She outthieved her sibling by taking more cookies from the jar.
meanings.sent2: The notorious criminal outthieved the police by stealing the priceless jewels.
meanings.sent3: The playful magpie outthieved the other birds by collecting the shiniest objects.
meanings.sent4: The clever pirate outthieved his crewmates in finding hidden treasures.
meanings.sent5: The skilled thief outthieved his rivals by executing daring heists.
